subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4 restructuring -- assertThat(..., Constraint)
msgSnippet: ... Something similar, yes. ... I m a dinosaur, so I keep saying test . Either way, not all specs are story-level specs, so I think the annotation @Story is
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > That's part of the way. The rest of the way would be not to use
> > assertions, but to write them with "should".
>
> I took another look at RSpec. It looks like it takes advantage of
> mix-ins to let you say:
>
> theAnswer.should_be_nil
>
> Is this the sort of thing you're saying?

Something similar, yes.

> > Also, I'm not sure @Story is right, there. Not all tests are story-tests.
>
> These aren't tests, but specifications, right? Or am I still missing it?

I'm a dinosaur, so I keep saying "test". Either way, not all specs are
story-level specs, so I think the annotation @Story is misleading.

There's an interesting change afoot: maybe the @Story annotation should
go on the class, and not on the method. Possibly @Story applies at a
higher level. I don't know. If we don't think of them as tests for
methods, then how do we organize them? (other than the obvious things
we've been doing--put 'em in one class until that gets too big, then
split based on fixture objects.)
--
